channel.title: Other OS Client
channel.description: Okay, I got my client to work on other operating systems, but there is a problem. When you load up the client and login, some of the images don't show up. It only works fully on windows(using same files). I tested on Ubuntu Linux 11.04, Windows XP, and Windows 7. The images, like the magic icons and prayer icons, don't show up on Ubuntu, but they show up fine for Windows. Terminal: [code]brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/Documents/client$ java client Loading GodWars Model Cache. GodWars Model Cache loaded. Parsing models....(A shit load) Loading New Maps. Total of 470 Maps added onto the world map! New Maps Loaded. bhicon1 bhicon2 bhicon3 bhicon4 bhicon5 admindot modicon1 modicon2 loading custom spirts part 1 iconh33 bluurricon1 hover1 hover2 chat1 skull1 multi1 loading custom spirts part 2 My code for findcachedir[code=java]public static String findcachedir(){ return String.format("%s/%s/", System.getProperty("user.home"), ".SageScape_file_store_32"); }[/code] A snippet for the code [code=java]Image image1 = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(findcachedir()+"/Files/Spirts/headhint1.png");[/code]

item.title: Other OS Client
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:394159”][quote author=sageofmali link=topic=491345.msg3593061#msg3593061 date=1304806639]
Okay, I got my client to work on other operating systems, but there is a problem. When you load up the client and login, some of the images don’t show up. It only works fully on windows(using same files). I tested on Ubuntu Linux 11.04, Windows XP, and Windows 7. The images, like the magic icons and prayer icons, don’t show up on Ubuntu, but they show up fine for Windows. Terminal: brandon@brandon-ET1331G:~/Desktop/Documents/client$ java client Loading GodWars Model Cache. GodWars Model Cache loaded. Parsing models....(A shit load) Loading New Maps. Total of 470 Maps added onto the world map! New Maps Loaded. bhicon1 bhicon2 bhicon3 bhicon4 bhicon5 admindot modicon1 modicon2 loading custom spirts part 1 iconh33 bluurricon1 hover1 hover2 chat1 skull1 multi1 loading custom spirts part 2 /home/brandon/.SageScape_file_store_32//Files/interface/welcome 1.png /home/brandon/.SageScape_file_store_32//Files/interface/welcome 2.png For some reason it’s saying “//” on things. My code for findcachedirpublic static String findcachedir(){ return String.format("%s/%s/", System.getProperty("user.home"), ".SageScape_file_store_32"); }
A snippet for the code Image image1 = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getImage(findcachedir()+"/Files/Spirts/headhint1.png");
[/quote]

Are you sure
findcachedir()+"/Files/Spirts/headhint1.png"

Is the right location? It looks like “Spirts” is spelled incorrectly.

Also, not sure if it matters but the string is ending up like
~/.SageScape_file_store_32//Files/Spirts/headhint1.png

I can’t remember if 2 “/” characters were valid in Linux.[/quote]
I fixed the “//” part; instead of it being “findcachedir()+”/" I made it “findcachedir()+”", but it still does the same thing. I’ll take a screenshot: But it works fine on Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: Other OS Client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sageofmali, post:1, topic:394159”]Okay, I got my client to work on other operating systems, but there is a problem. When you load up the client and login, some of the images don’t show up. It only works fully on windows(using same files). I tested on Ubuntu Linux 11.04, Windows XP, and Windows 7. The images, like the magic icons and prayer icons, don’t show up on Ubuntu, but they show up fine for Windows. Is the right location? It looks like “Spirts” is spelled incorrectly.

I can’t remember if 2 “/” characters were valid in Linux.

Read full topic

item.title: Other OS Client
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Okay, I got my client to work on other operating systems, but there is a problem. When you load up the client and login, some of the images don’t show up. It only works fully on windows(using same files). I tested on Ubuntu Linux 11.04, Windows XP, and Windows 7. The images, like the magic icons and prayer icons, don’t show up on Ubuntu, but they show up fine for Windows.
